column4: either a screenshot or terminal output on pastebin might help
preferably terminal output since it's more informative
and for some unknown reason, it doesn't do it automatically like everything else
compiz is not installed by default?  It was for me.
Since when? I've often had the same error message he's claiming to have and going in and installing compiz related packages (including compiz itself) removed it.
I don't know.  Just re-installed 9.04 on a computer today, and compiz shows up among the processes
It was disabled by the X developers, apparently there was a vote and they decided it was good to disable it
Lemme guess, same with the print screen button now having to do with music or something instead of screenshots as well? XD
Not sure about that :)
Section "ServerFlags" | Option "DontZap" "Off" | EndSection
Where each '|' indicates a new line
i recently discovered that change and it was really annoying really quickly because i had to find another way to take a screnshot, whcih i eventually did, but still annoying.
any other key changes i should know about?
Not that I know of
I sure hope there isn't. XD Last thing i need is weird windows poping up when i press numlock or something.
Haha, I know the feeling.  I had a heck of a time with my laptop trying to use SysRq.  I had to type and release a couple keys in a certain order to get it to work
Of the complaints of linux, the only lagitimate ones i heard mostly surrounded keybindings and such.
There were other lagitimate ones of course, just most people have key trouble
Yeah, when the keys don't work as you expect, things can get pretty difficult
Haha, nice.  At least a good learning experience :P
Next thing you know, they'll add a purge shortcut to gedit and it'll delete the text and the file
